posts.name: Mr.R^2
posts.cooked:
We are in the 2022 Beta and finally got to our benchtop test today, amd we wanted to try out the new PS4 controller classes, but we could not get them to show up in the driver station.

I could post over in the beta forum, but wanted to begin here as I feel there is a more basic issue we are missing.

How do you go about setting up the driver station conputer to work with the ps 4 controller. Are you installing any special drivers? Are you using a special cable (or bluetooth for at-home testing), is there anything else we may be missing?

We are running win 10 and I think the driver’s station was v 2022b8 if memory serves.

We are off until the beginning of the year, but I juat ordered a ps4 controller to troubleshoot on my own.
I’m fairly certain that to use a PS4 controller with a windows computer, you need to use a program like DS4Windows .

posts.name: Mr.R^2
posts.cooked: Thank you. We tried that, but the install failled. I will start there when I get my hands on one.

posts.name: Allen Nuttle
posts.cooked: If you are trying to use the controller wirelessly, I wouldn’t be surprised if it weren’t intentionally not working.  In any case, I’d try with it connected via USB if you aren’t doing this already.

posts.name: Mr.R^2
posts.cooked:
We tried going wired first. When that did not work, we tried wirelessly. Both times, it showed up in Windows as “Wireless Controller” so that may have been it.

I do qonder if anyone has gotten this to work without DS4Win

posts.name: Wolly :)
posts.cooked: I haven’t dabbled too much with controllers but from my experience Playstation controllers need a software like the one mentioned above or scptoolkit to interface. XBOX and Logitech controllers are automatically recognized (obligatory plug for Logitech F310 - reliable and a lot of teams use them so you can borrow if needed)

posts.name: Allen Nuttle
posts.cooked: FWIW, I have successfully used a PS4 controller (wired) with 2020/21 DS with no issues – the only thing is that the controls do not all map 1:1.  No special S/W or driver.

The PS4 controller shows up on the DS as “Wireless Controller”; I’m not sure if we have DS4Win on the laptop. We only connect through USB, I think that the DS does not read any non-USB HID connections.

As for channel mappings, the ones used in the PS4Controller class are what I saw on our DS. If anyone finds mismatches, open an issue on the allwpilib repo.

posts.name: Mr.R^2
posts.cooked:
Thank you all for your help. I am still not 100% clear on everything, but we have made a lot of progress.

DS4 for Windows is indeed required. However, in some circumstances, it may not need to be running (this is one thing I am not yet clear on). DS4Windows does install an updated driver, and we needed to use the new version that has been forked and more recently updated rather than the latest version of the original.

With DS4 for Windows, does allow you to use Bluetooth for shop and practice access. Of course, this will almost definitely not be allowed at an event (new Bluetooth protocols have a large range, so even pits and practice fields could pose a problem). We will know this for certain on Saturday, but I do not see the rules changing on this any time soon.

The Wireless controller version works, but the xbox360 emulation has more features. It seems all features (including vibrate) work. However, if you are not using the driverstation (so only glass), the center pad turns into a mousepad when you touch it. There may be a setting to fix this, but we have not really investigated.

Thank you again for all of your help.

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
